humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 9 cm, which falls under the T3 category of 'tumors more than 5 cm in size'. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The tumor diameter is 9 cm, which falls in the T3 category (tumor size > 5 cm). The T stage is based on the size of the primary tumor, and in this case, the report clearly states that the tumor diameter is 9 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T3.
